title: Ruth Langsford sends fans into meltdown with video of 87-year-old mum's dance moves
text:

Ruth Langsford posted a heartwarming video of her mum, 87, dancing the night away at a 60th wedding anniversary on Saturday night.

The This Morning host "couldn't get her off the dance floor" saying that she "still has the moves" at the family bash.

In the video, her mum Joan can be seen having the time of her life as she shakes her hips from side to side, while even dropping low at one point.

She appears to be laughing with her friend while a band plays in the background.

The presenter's caption read: "Go Mum! Family 60th Wedding Anniversary Party last night....couldn’t get her off the dance floor! 87yrs old and still has the moves!"

(Image: Twitter)

Ruth's fans loved the joyful video as they left sweet comments to Joan regarding her dance moves, and it seems Ruth takes after her mum in the dancing area.

One commented: "Aww, so very to see Ruth! Fantastic to see your Mum enjoy herself, dancing away.

"She certainly has the moves...as do you. Brilliant stuff! Go Joan!"

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: Twitter)

Another joked: "What a dancer. Bless. No excuse now Ruth", with a laughing emoji.

A third fan even suggested that Strictly would want Joan on the show: "Brilliant. She looks like she having the best time ever. Strictly will have an eye on her", she wrote.

Ruth's husband Eamonn recently got told off by fans on Saturday for a hilarious snap about her from a date night together to a hat party.

(Image: ITV)

The photo showed both of them just before heading out, and Eamonn rocked a black cowboy hat.

His caption said: "Who's The Witch in the background? I hear you ask.. If the hat fits ... wear it I say!"

But fans were quick to tell him off for his comment, as they jumped in with: "Mr Holmes! Be nice to your lady," while another wrote: "Not a nice thing to say about your wife."

A third added: "Ahh don't be mean!"
description: The TV presenter's mum brought the party with her dance moves at a family wedding anniversary bash
